intro: Apluda inermis, commonly known as the slender grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides, and it is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Apluda inermis is an annual or biennial plant that produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of ecological studies related to plant succession and soil stabilization.
